translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: [مدعی‌] نه [حق را] تصدیق کرد، و نه نمازگزارد

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: (در آن روز گفته می‌شود:) او هرگز ایمان نیاورد و نماز نخواند،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس نه تصدیق کرد و نه نماز گزارد

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: نه باور داشت و نه نماز گزارد

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: پس او نه تصدیق کرد و نه نماز خواند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: For he neither believed nor prayed,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Neither did he believe it to be true, nor did he offer the prayer.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: For he confirmed it not, and did not pray,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: He neither believed nor prayed,

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: So he (the disbeliever) neither believed (in this Quran, in the Message of Muhammad SAW) nor prayed!

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: He neither believed nor prayed.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: But he did not verify the Truth, nor did he observe Prayer;

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: So, he neither believed nor prayed!

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: For he neither trusted, nor prayed.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: He neither confirmed [the messages of Allah], nor did he pray,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Because, he neither believed nor prayed;

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And the disbeliever had not believed, nor had he prayed.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: The human being does not want to believe the Truth, nor does he want to pray.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: So he did not accept the truth, nor did he pray,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Fal<u>a</u> <u>s</u>addaqa wal<u>a</u> <u>s</u>all<u>a</u>

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: He neither believed nor prayed,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: So he gave nothing in charity, nor did he pray!-

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: بلکه [در میان اجتماعات] تکذیب کرد و روی گرداند؛

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: اما تكذيب كرده و اعراض كرده است.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: بلكه تكذيب كرد و روى گردانيد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: بلكه تكذيب كرد و روى‌گردان شد،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: بلکه (خدا را) تکذیب کرد و (از حکمش) رو بگردانید.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: بلکه راه تکذیب (حق و حقیقت) را در پیش گرفته است و (به فرمان خدا) پشت کرده است. [[«کَذَّبَ وَ تَوَلّی»: (نگا: طه / 48).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: بلکه دروغ انگاشت و رویگردان شد

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: بلکه تکذیب کرد و روی‌گردان شد،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: و لیکن تکذیب کرد و روی برتافت‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: و ليكن دروغ انگاشت و روى گرداند

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: بلکه رویگرداند.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: But only disavowed and turned away;

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: But he denied and turned away.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: but he cried it lies, and he turned away,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: But he belied and turned away.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: But on the contrary, he belied (this Quran and the Message of Muhammad SAW) and turned away!

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: But he denied and turned away.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: on the contrary, he gave the lie to the Truth and turned his back upon it,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: But on the contrary, he denied and turned away!

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: But he denied and flouted.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: but denied [them] and turned away,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: he belied the truth and turned away;

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: But [instead], he denied and turned away.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: He rejects the faith, turns away

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: But called the truth a lie and turned back,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Wal<u>a</u>kin ka<u>thth</u>aba watawall<u>a</u>

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: but rejected the Truth and turned away!

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: But on the contrary, he rejected Truth and turned away!

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: سپس متکبرانه و خرامان به سوی کسانش رفت.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: آنگاه خرامان نزد كسانش رفته است.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: سپس مغرورانه سوى كسانش رفت

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: سپس بسوى خانواده خود باز گشت در حالى كه متكبّرانه قدم برمى‌داشت!

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و آن گاه با تکبر و نخوت به سوی اهل خویش روی آورد.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: گذشته از این، مغرورانه و متکبّرانه (از کفر و عناد خود) نزد خانواده و کسانش برگشته است. [[«یَتَمَطّی»: می‌نازد و بزرگی می‌فروشد. تفرعُن و تکبّر می‌کند.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: سپس تبخترکنان به سوی خانواده‌اش رفت‌

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: سپس بسوی خانواده خود بازگشت در حالی که متکبّرانه قدم برمی‌داشت!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس روان شد بسوی خاندان خویش خرامان (خمیازه‌کشان)

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: سپس خرامان به سوى كسانش رفت

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: سپس سوی خانه‌ی خود بازگشت در حالی که چون خران (خرامان) قدم برمی‌داشت!

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Then he strutted back to his people.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Then he went back to his home in pride.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: then he went to his household arrogantly.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Then he departed Unto his house hold conceitedly.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Then he walked in full pride to his family admiring himself!

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Then he went to his family, full of pride.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: then he went back to his kinsfolk, elated with pride.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Then he walked in conceit to his family admiring himself!

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Then went he to his folk with glee.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: and went back swaggering to his family.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: then went arrogantly to his household.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And then he went to his people, swaggering [in pride].

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: and haughtily goes to his people.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Then he went to his followers, walking away in haughtiness.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Thumma <u>th</u>ahaba il<u>a</u> ahlihi yatama<u>tta</u>

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Then he went off to his people, swaggering.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Then did he stalk to his family in full conceit!

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: [و گویند: با این وضعی که داری، عذاب دوزخ] برای تو شایسته تر است، شایسته تر!

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: واى بر تو، پس واى بر تو.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: [با اين اعمال‌] واى بر تو! پس واى بر تو

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: (با اين اعمال) عذاب الهى براى تو شايسته‌تر است، شايسته‌تر!

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: (به وی خطاب شود) وای (بر زندگی) و (صد) وای بر (مرگ) تو.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: مرگ بر تو! مرگ! [[«أَوْلَی»: سزاوارتر. درخورتر. مراد سزاوارتر به مرگ و نابودی است. بعضی گفته‌اند: فعل ماضی است؛ یعنی خدا مرگ تو را نزدیک گرداند و نابودت کند!]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: وای بر تو، باز هم وای بر تو

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: (با این اعمال) عذاب الهی برای تو شایسته‌تر است، شایسته‌تر!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: تو را سزد پس تو را سزد

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: واى بر تو پس واى بر تو

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: (این ناهنجاری) شایسته‌تر است برای تو، پس شایسته‌تر.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Alas the woe for you, alas!

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Your ruin has come close, still closer.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Nearer to thee and nearer

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Woe Unto thee; woe!

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Woe to you [O man (disbeliever)]! And then (again) woe to you!

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Woe to you; and woe.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: This (attitude) is worthy of you, altogether worthy;

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Woe to you! And then woe to you!

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Nearer unto thee and nearer,

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: So, woe to you! Woe to you!

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Near to you and nearer,

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Woe to you, and woe!

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Woe to you!

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Nearer to you (is destruction) and nearer,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Awl<u>a</u> laka faawl<u>a</u>

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Woe to you, [O man!], yes, woe to you.

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Woe to thee, (O men!), yea, woe!

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: باز هم شایسته تر است شایسته تر.

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: باز هم واى بر تو، پس واى بر تو.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: باز هم واى بر تو! سپس واى بر تو

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: سپس عذاب الهى براى تو شايسته‌تر است، شايسته‌تر!

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: پس (از مرگ هم) وای (بر برزخ) و (صد) وای بر (روز محشر) تو.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: باز هم، مرگ بر تو! مرگ! [[«أَوْلَی»: تکرار برای تأکید است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: سپس وای بر تو، و باز هم وای بر تو

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: سپس عذاب الهی برای تو شایسته‌تر است، شایسته‌تر!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: سپس تو را سزد پس تو را سزد

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: باز هم واى بر تو پس واى بر تو.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: سپس (این ناهنجاری) برای تو شایسته‌تر است، پس شایسته‌تر.

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Alas, the woe for you!

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Again your ruin has come close, still closer.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: then nearer to thee and nearer!

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Again, woe Unto thee, woe!

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Again, woe to you [O man (disbeliever)]! And then (again) woe to you!

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Then again: Woe to you; and woe.

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: again, it is worthy of you, altogether worthy.

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Again, woe to you! And then woe to you!

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Again nearer unto thee and nearer (is the doom).

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Again, woe to you! Woe to you!

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: then nearer to you and nearer!

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Then woe to you, and woe!

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Woe to you!

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Again (consider how) nearer to you and nearer.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Thumma awl<u>a</u> laka faawl<u>a</u>

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Again, woe to you, [O man!], yes, woe to you!

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Again, Woe to thee, (O men!), yea, woe!

verses.text: أَ يَحْسَبُ‌ الْإِنْسَانُ‌ أَنْ‌ يُتْرَکَ‌ سُدًى‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: آیا انسان گمان می کند بیهوده و مهمل [و بدون تکلیف و مسؤولیت] رها می شود؟!

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: آيا انسان مى‌پندارد كه او را به حال خود واگذاشته‌اند؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: آيا انسان مى‌پندارد كه بى‌هدف رها مى‌شود

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: آيا انسان گمان مى‌كند بى‌هدف رها مى‌شود؟!

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آیا آدمی می‌پندارد که او را مهمل (از تکلیف و ثواب و عقاب) گذارند (و غرضی در خلقتش منظور ندارند).

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: آیا انسان (منکر معاد) می‌پندارد که او بیهوده به حال خود رها شود (و قوانین و مقرّرات الهی، و حساب و کتاب و سزا و جزای دنیوی و اخروی نداشته باشد؟!). [[«سُدیً»: بیهوده. رها. یعنی انسان با وجود داشتن عقل، همچون حیوان بی‌صاحب، به حال خود واگذاشته شود، و تکالیف و وظائف و همچنین سزا و جزائی نداشته باشد. حال است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: آیا انسان می‌پندارد که به امان خود رها خواهد شد؟

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آیا انسان گمان می‌کند بی‌هدف رها می‌شود؟!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: آیا پندارد انسان که گذارده شود رها

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: آيا آدمى مى‌پندارد كه او را بيهوده و رها فرو گذارند- كه در دنيا مكلّف نباشد و در آخرت برانگيخته و حسابرسى نشود و پاداش و كيفر نبيند-؟!

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: آیا انسان گمان می‌کند که بی‌هدف و مهمل رها می‌شود؟!

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Does man think that he will be left alone to himself, free?

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Does man assume that he will be let loose?

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: What, does man reckon he shall be left to roam at will?

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Deemest man that he is to be left uncontrolled?

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Does man think that he will be left Suda [neglected without being punished or rewarded for the obligatory duties enjoined by his Lord (Allah) on him]?

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Does man think that he will be left without purpose?

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Does man think that he will be left alone, unquestioned?

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Does man think that he will be left neglected

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Thinketh man that he is to be left aimless?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Does man suppose that he has been abandoned to futility?

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Does the human think he will be left to roam at will?

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Does man think that he will be left neglected?

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: For you, the human being of such behavior, will certainly deserve it.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Does man think that he is to be left to wander without an aim?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Ayahsabu alinsanu an yutraka sudan

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Does man, then, think that he is to be left to himself, to go about at will?

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Does man think that he will be left uncontrolled, (without purpose)?

verses.text: أَ لَمْ‌ يَکُ‌ نُطْفَةً مِنْ‌ مَنِيٍ‌ يُمْنَى‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: آیا نطفه ای از منی که در رحم ریخته می شود نبود؟

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: آيا او نطفه‌اى از منى كه در رحمى ريخته شده، نبوده است؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: مگر او نطفه‌اى كه [در رحم‌] ريخته مى‌شود نبود

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: آيا او نطفه‌اى از منى كه در رحم ريخته مى‌شود نبود؟!

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آیا آدمی قطره آب نطفه نبود که (در رحم) ریزند؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: آیا او نطفه‌ی ناچیزی از منی نیست که (به رحم مادر) پرت و ریخته می‌گردد؟ [[«یُمْنی»: پرت می‌شود و ریخته می‌گردد. «مِن مَّنِیٍّ یُمْنی»: (نگا: نجم / 46، واقعه / 37).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: آیا نطفه‌ای از منی که [در رحم‌] ریخته شده بود، نبود؟

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آیا او نطفه‌ای از منی که در رحم ریخته می‌شود نبود؟!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: آیا نبود چکّه‌ای از منی که ریخته شود

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: آيا او نطفه‌اى از منى كه [در رحم‌] ريخته مى‌شد، نبود؟

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: آیا او نطفه‌ای از منی‌ای که می‌جهد نبود؟!

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Was he not an emitted drop of semen,

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: Was he not just a drop of the semen that is discharged?

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Was he not a sperm-drop spilled?

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Was he not a sperm of emission emitted?

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Was he not a Nutfah (mixed male and female discharge of semen) poured forth?

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Was he not a drop of ejaculated semen?

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Was he not a drop of ejaculated semen,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Was he not a Nutfah of semen emitted

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Was he not a drop of fluid which gushed forth?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Was he not a drop of emitted semen,

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: What, was he not an ejaculated drop (of sperm)?

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Had he not been a sperm from semen emitted?

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Does the human being think that he will be left uncontrolled?

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Was he not a small seed in the seminal elements,

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Alam yaku nu<u>t</u>fatan min manayyin yumn<u>a</u>

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Was he not once a drop of ejaculated semen,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Was he not a drop of sperm emitted (in lowly form)?

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: سپس علقه شد و خدا او را آفرید و اندامش را درست و نیکو ساخت،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: سپس لخته‌اى خون؟ آنگاه به اندام درستش بيافريد.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: سپس خون بسته‌اى شد و [خدايش‌] شكل داد و درست كرد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: سپس بصورت خون‌بسته در آمد، و خداوند او را آفريد و موزون ساخت،

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: و پس از نطفه خون بسته شد و آن گاه (خدایش به این صورت زیبای حیرت انگیز) آفرید و آراسته ساخت.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: سپس به صورت خون لخته و دَلَمه‌ای درآمده است، و خداوند او را آفرینش تازه‌ای بخشیده است، و بعد اندام او را نظم و نظام و سر و سامان داده است؟ [[«عَلَقَةً»: خون لخته و دَلَمه (نگا: حجّ / 5، مؤمنون / 14، غافر / 67). «سَوّی»: اندام او را همآهنگ کرد و سر و سامان داد (نگا: بقره / 29، کهف / 37، حجر / 29).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: سپس خون بسته‌ای بود که [خداوندش‌] آفرید و به سامان کرد

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: سپس بصورت خون بسته در آمد، و خداوند او را آفرید و موزون ساخت،

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس گردید خونی بسته پس بیافرید پس بیاراست‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: سپس خون بسته بود، پس [خدايش‌] بيافريد و درست اندام كرد؟

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: سپس به صورت خون بسته‌‌ای [:آویزک] در آمد. پس خدا او را آفرید و سازمان داد،

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Then formed into an embryo? Then He fashioned, shaped and proportioned

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: He then became a clot – so Allah created him, then made him proper.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: Then he was a blood-clot, and He created and formed,

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Then he became a clot; then He created him and formed him.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Then he became an 'Alaqa (a clot); then (Allah) shaped and fashioned (him) in due proportion.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Then he became a clot. And He created and proportioned?

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: then he became a clot, and then Allah made it into a living body and proportioned its parts,

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Then he became an `Alaqah; then shaped and fashioned in due proportion.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Then he became a clot; then (Allah) shaped and fashioned

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: and then a clinging mass? Whereat He created and proportioned [him],

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: Then he was a clot of blood, then He created and formed him

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Then he was a clinging clot, and [Allah] created [his form] and proportioned [him]

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Was he not once just a drop of discharged sperm.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Then he was a clot of blood, so He created (him) then made (him) perfect.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Thumma k<u>a</u>na AAalaqatan fakhalaqa fasaww<u>a</u>

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: which then became a leech-like clot; then God shaped and fashioned him in due proportion,

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Then did he become a leech-like clot; then did (Allah) make and fashion (him) in due proportion.

verses.text: فَجَعَلَ‌ مِنْهُ‌ الزَّوْجَيْنِ‌ الذَّکَرَ وَ الْأُنْثَى‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: و از او دو زوج به وجود آورد یکی نر و دیگر ماده،

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: و آنها را دو صنف كرد: نر و ماده.

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: پس دو جنس نر و ماده را از آن، پديد آورد

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: و از او دو زوج مرد و زن آفريد!

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: پس آن گاه از او دو صنف نر و ماده پدید آورد.

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: و از این (انسان) دو صنف نر و ماده را ساخته و پرداخته است. [[«مِنْهُ»: از انسان. «الزَّوْجَیْنِ»: دو صِنف. دو نوع (نگا: هود / 40، رعد / 3، نجم / 45). «الذَّکَرَ وَ الأُنثی»: بدل است.]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: و از آن جفتی نرینه و مادینه پدید آورد

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: و از او دو زوج مرد و زن آفرید!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: پس گردانید از او دو جفت را نر و ماده‌

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: پس، از آن دو گونه: مرد و زن، ساخت.

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: تا از او دو زوج : مرد و زن آفرید!

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: And assigned it sexes, male and female.

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: So created from him a pair, the male and female.

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: and He made of him two kinds, male and female.

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: And made of him the two sexes, male and female.

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: And made him in two sexes, male and female.

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: And made of him the two sexes, the male and the female?

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: and then He made of him a pair, male and female?

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: And made of him two sexes, male and female.

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: And made of him a pair, the male and female.

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: and made of him the two sexes, male and female.

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: and made from him two kinds, male and female.

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: And made of him two mates, the male and the female.

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Was he not turned into a clot of blood? God then formed him and gave him proper shape. From the human being, God made males and females in pairs.

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Then He made of him two kinds, the male and the female.

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: FajaAAala minhu alzzawjayni alththakara waalontha

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: fashioning out of him the two sexes, the male and the female?

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: And of him He made two sexes, male and female.

verses.text: أَ لَيْسَ‌ ذٰلِکَ‌ بِقَادِرٍ عَلَى‌ أَنْ‌ يُحْيِيَ‌ الْمَوْتَى‌

translations.name: Hussain Ansarian
translations.text: آیا چنین نیرومند آگاهی توانا نیست که مردگان را زنده کند؟

translations.name: AbdolMohammad Ayati
translations.text: آيا خداوند قادر نيست كه مردگان را زنده سازد؟

translations.name: Abolfazl Bahrampour
translations.text: آيا اين [خدا] قادر نيست كه مردگان را زنده كند

translations.name: Mohammad Mahdi Fooladvand
translations.text: آيا چنين كسى قادر نيست كه مردگان را زنده كند؟!

translations.name: Mahdi Elahi Ghomshei
translations.text: آیا چنین خدای (با قدرت و حکمت) باز نتواند مردگان را زنده گرداند؟

translations.name: Mostafa Khorramdel
translations.text: آیا چنین خدائی نمی‌تواند مردگان را زنده گرداند؟! [[«أَلَیْسَ ذلِکَ ...»: (نگا: یس / 81).]]

translations.name: Baha'oddin Khorramshahi
translations.text: آیا آن [آفریدگار] توانا بر آن نیست که مردگان را زنده کند؟

translations.name: Naser Makarem Shirazi
translations.text: آیا چنین کسی قادر نیست که مردگان را زنده کند؟!

translations.name: Mohammad Kazem Moezzi
translations.text: آیا نیست آن توانا بر آنکه زنده سازد مرده‌گان را

translations.name: Sayyed Jalaloddin Mojtabavi
translations.text: آيا آن [خداى‌] قادرى نيست كه مردگان را زنده كند؟

translations.name: Mohammad Sadeqi Tehrani
translations.text: آیا (چنان نیرومندی‌) بر زنده کردن مردگان توانا نیست‌؟!

translations.name: Ahmed Ali
translations.text: Cannot such as He bring the dead to life?

translations.name: Ahmed Raza Khan
translations.text: So will He, Who has done all this, not be able to revive the dead?

translations.name: A. J. Arberry
translations.text: What, is He not able to quicken the dead?

translations.name: Abdul Majid Daryabadi
translations.text: Is not That One then Able to quicken the dead?

translations.name: Muhammad Taqi-ud-Din al-Hilali and Muhammad Muhsin Khan
translations.text: Is not He (Allah Who does that), Able to give life to the dead? (Yes! He is Able to do all things).

translations.name: Talal Itani
translations.text: Is He not Able to revive the dead?

translations.name: Abul Ala Maududi
translations.text: Does He, then, not have the power to bring back the dead to life?

translations.name: Safi-ur-Rahman al-Mubarakpuri
translations.text: Is it not so then, that He would be able to give life to the dead

translations.name: Mohammed Marmaduke William Pickthall
translations.text: Is not He (Who doeth so) Able to bring the dead to life?

translations.name: Ali Quli Qarai
translations.text: Is not [someone like] that able to revive the dead?

translations.name: Hasan al-Fatih Qaribullah and Ahmad Darwish
translations.text: What, is He then unable to revive the dead?

translations.name: Saheeh International
translations.text: Is not that [Creator] Able to give life to the dead?

translations.name: Muhammad Sarwar
translations.text: Does He then not have the power to bring the dead back to life?

translations.name: Mohammad Habib Shakir
translations.text: Is not He able to give life to the dead?

translations.name: English Transliteration
translations.text: Alaysa <u>tha</u>lika biq<u>a</u>dirin AAal<u>a</u> an yu<u>h</u>yiya almawt<u>a</u>

translations.name: Wahiduddin Khan
translations.text: Then is He not able to bring the dead back to life?

translations.name: Abdullah Yusuf Ali
translations.text: Has not He, (the same), the power to give life to the dead?
